title: Figma Launches AI-Powered Erase, Isolate, and Expand Tools for Seamless Canvas Editing

paragraphs.content: Figma announced three new AI-powered image editing tools—Erase object, Isolate object, and Expand image—on December 10, 2025, enabling precise edits directly on the canvas without exporting to apps like Photoshop. These tools consolidate with existing features like Remove background and Crop into a revamped toolbar, available now in Figma Design and Draw for Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled. The update addresses time-consuming workflows for adapting images to different formats and devices.

paragraphs.content: A 49-second official demo video showcases the toolbar, stating users can "make, edit, and refine visuals without ever leaving your file." User-generated YouTube content from mid-December celebrates ending the need to juggle design tools for object removal and adjustments. Early reactions highlight efficiency gains for designers avoiding multi-app chaos.

sections.title: Breakdown of Erase, Isolate, and Expand Capabilities

paragraphs.content: Erase object uses an improved lasso tool to select and remove unwanted elements without text prompts, preserving image stability. Isolate object separates a subject for repositioning or effects like blur, lighting, desaturation, shadow, or focus while retaining background characteristics. Expand image extends backgrounds to new aspect ratios, such as square shots to landscape banners, without distortion.

paragraphs.content: The toolbar centralizes these with Crop and prominent Remove background placement due to high usage for UI mockups and brand consistency. Tools prioritize fine-tuned control over generative AI, making them accessible for non-experts. This setup supports tasks like annotations, color tweaks, and text overlays in one place.

paragraphs.content: Figma's release notes list this as part of 150+ 2025 features, calling it the "last note for 2025" with centralized AI editing in a contextual toolbar. Availability targets Full seat users on paid plans with AI enabled, with expansion to more products planned for 2026. The tools build on existing AI image generation for a complete editing suite.

Community plugins like Bria AI complement the native tools with one-click editing options updated in late December 2025. No-code solutions via Figma Make further integrate AI photo editing for app builders. Broader rollout promises deeper platform embedding next year.
